thread.title: Jay Z Salutes Should-Be Rap Honorees in Songwriters Hall of Fame Playlist
thread.title_full: Jay Z Salutes Should-Be Rap Honorees in Songwriters Hall of Fame Playlist

author: Adelle Platon
title: Jay Z Salutes Should-Be Rap Honorees in Songwriters Hall of Fame Playlist
text:
COMMENTS Kevin Mazur/Getty Images for TIDAL Jay-Z performs onstage during TIDAL X: 1020 Amplified by HTC at Barclays Center of Brooklyn on Oct. 20, 2015 in New York City. 
After becoming the first rapper to be inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame, Jay Z headed straight to Tidal to salute his contemporaries in a special playlist. 
Setting the party off is Grandmaster Flash and The Furious Five's "The Message," featuring Melle Mel and Duke Bootee, followed by Nas ' "If I Ruled the World (Imagine That)" and classics from Lauryn Hill , OutKast , Kanye West , N.W.A , Eminem and 2Pac . 

Hov also shared the honor in a rare tweet. "By the way, this is a win for US," he typed. "I remember when rap was said to be a fad. We are now alongside some of the greatest writers in history." By the way, this is a win for US. I remember when rap was said to be a fad . We are now alongside some of the greatest writers in history. â€” Mr. Carter (@S_C_) February 22, 2017 
Listen to Jay Z's Songwriters HOF-themed playlist above.
